page.title: 02COOK'S BRIDGE FARM (CONT.)
page.content: Then we went to see a bull;he was massive! He was nearly 2m.tall, weighed nearly a tonne and had a ring through his nose. Then we went to the milking parlour.We saw the electric milking machine and the farmer told us to put our thumbs in a black rubber thing which went on the cows udders_ it felt like someone was sucking our thumb. 14 cows could be milked at one time using this machine.The milk travelled along some pipes and was collected in a large stainless steel container. Every day the cows produced between 1700 and 1800 litres of milk.
